name: abstraction
content:
abstraction noun [C or U]
(NOT REAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of existing as or representing an idea, a feeling, etc. and not a material object, or something that has this quality: They discuss the issue of realism versus abstraction in sculpture. Actual black holes have been found: they are no longer mathematical abstractions.
the quality of being very general and not based on real examples, or something that has this quality: She's always talking in abstractions. He has a tendency towards abstraction and pretentiousness which weakens his argument. Related word
abstract adjective
More examplesFewer examplesOne of the problems of modern art for many people is its abstraction.The exhibition features abstractions by one of America's best-known post-war artists.He talked about his love for the purity and abstraction of mathematics.The practical details which interest students may seem quite different from the high-level concepts and abstractions discussed by academics.Laura had no time for such abstraction and wanted to know what was actually needed.
